0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Bleeding - Hemophilia A: dosage calculation: body weight (kg) X factor VIII activity increase desired (%) divided by 2% per international unit per kg = dose required (international units)
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Alphanate(R): minor hemorrhage, 15 international units/kg twice daily to increase FVIII levels to 30% of normal until hemorrhage stops (1 to 2 days)
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Alphanate(R): moderate hemorrhage, 25 international units/kg twice daily to increase FVIII levels to 50% of normal until hemorrhage stops (2 to 7 days)
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Alphanate(R): major hemorrhage, 40 to 50 international units/kg twice daily to increase FVIII levels to 80% to 100% % for at least 3 to 5 days. Then 25 international units/kg twice daily until healing achieved for up to 10 days
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Humate-P(R): minor hemorrhage, loading dose, 15 international units/kg to increase FVIII levels to 30% of normal, one dose may be sufficient; if needed 7.5 international units/kg once or twice daily for 1 to 2 days
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Humate-P(R): moderate hemorrhage, loading dose, 25 international units/kg to increase FVIII levels to 50% of normal, followed by 15 international units/kg every 8 to 12 hours for 1 to 2 days to maintain FVIII levels at 30% of normal, then 15 international units/kg once or twice daily for a total of up to 7 days or until adequate wound healing
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Humate-P(R): life-threatening hemorrhage, loading dose, 40 to 50 international units/kg followed by 20 to 25 international units/kg every 8 hours to maintain FVIII levels at 80% to 100% of normal for 7 days, then 20 to 25 international units/kg once or twice daily for another 7 days to maintain the FVIII level at 30% to 50% of normal
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Alphanate(R): preoperative dose, 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV; subsequent doses, 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV every 8 to 12 hours as needed until healing is complete, dosing may be reduced after the third postoperative dose if necessary
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Alphanate(R): minor surgery goal: administer IV dose necessary to maintain von Willebrand factor activity or 40 to 50% during postop days 1 to 3
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Alphanate(R): major surgery goal: administer IV dose necessary to maintain von Willebrand factor activity or 40 to 50% during postop days 3 to 7
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): emergency surgery, loading dose 50 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): loading dose calculation involves acquiring individual in vivo recovery (IVR) values and is based on target peak VWF:RCo and FVIII:C levels, when not available a standardized loading dose may be used, VWF:RCo IVR of 2 IU/dL per IU/kg of VWF:RCo product administered
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): initial maintenance dose should be half the loading dose
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): subsequent maintenance dose is based on trough VWF:RCo and FVIII:C levels administered generally every 8 to 12 hours
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): 40 to 80 international units of von Willebrand Factor measured with the ristocetin cofactor assay (VWF:RCo) (17 to 33 international units Factor VIII)/kg every IV 8 to 12 hours, repeat as needed; 1 international unit of factor VIII activity/kg will increase the circulating VWF:RCo of approximately 5 international units/dL
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): (type 1 mild disease and VWF:RCo activity greater than 30%) major hemorrhage, loading dose 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV; maintenance dose, 40 to 50 international units VWF:RCo/kg every 8 to 12 hours for 3 days to keep the VWF:RCo trough level greater than 50%; continue 40 to 50 international units VWF:RCo/kg daily for a total of up to 7 days of treatment
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): (type 1 moderate or severe disease and VWF:RCo activity less than 30%), minor hemorrhage, 40 to 50 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV for 1 or 2 doses
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): (type 1 moderate or severe disease and VWF:RCo activity less than 30%) major hemorrhage, loading dose of 50 to 75 international units VWF:RCo/kg; maintenance dose, 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV every 8 to 12 hours for 3 days to keep the VWF:RCo trough level greater than 50%; continue 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg daily for a total of up to 7 days of treatment
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): (types 2 (all variants) and type 3 disease), minor hemorrhage, 40 to 50 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV for 1 or 2 doses
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R):(types 2 (all variants) and type 3 disease) major hemorrhage, loading dose 60 to 80 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV; maintenance dose, 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg every 8 to 12 hours for 3 days to keep the VWF:RCo trough level greater than 50%; continue 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg daily for a total of up to 7 days of treatment
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Wilate(R): minor hemorrhage, loading dose of 20 to 40 international units of von Willebrand Factor measured with the ristocetin cofactor assay (VWF:RCo)/kg IV at a rate of 2 to 4 mL/min; maintenance dosage, 20 to 30 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV at a rate of 2 to 4 mL/min every 12 to 24 hr for up to 3 days to keep the VWF:RCo and FVIII activity trough levels greater than 30%
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Wilate(R): major hemorrhage, loading dose of 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV at a rate of 2 to 4 mL/min; maintenance dosage, 20 to 40 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV at a rate of 2 to 4 mL/min every 12 to 24 hr for up to 5 to 7 days to keep the VWF:RCo and FVIII activity trough levels greater than 50%

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Bleeding - Hemophilia A: dosage calculation: body weight (kg) X factor VIII activity increase desired (%) divided by 2% per international unit per kg = dose required (international units)
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Alphanate(R): minor hemorrhage, 15 international units/kg twice daily to increase FVIII levels to 30% of normal until hemorrhage stops (1 to 2 days)
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Alphanate(R): moderate hemorrhage, 25 international units/kg twice daily to increase FVIII levels to 50% of normal until hemorrhage stops (2 to 7 days)
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Alphanate(R): major hemorrhage, 40 to 50 international units/kg twice daily to increase FVIII levels to 80% to 100% % for at least 3 to 5 days. Then 25 international units/kg twice daily until healing achieved for up to 10 days
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Humate-P(R): minor hemorrhage, loading dose, 15 international units/kg to increase FVIII levels to 30% of normal, one dose may be sufficient; if needed 7.5 international units/kg once or twice daily for 1 to 2 days
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Humate-P(R): moderate hemorrhage, loading dose, 25 international units/kg to increase FVIII levels to 50% of normal, followed by 15 international units/kg every 8 to 12 hours for 1 to 2 days to maintain FVIII levels at 30% of normal, then 15 international units/kg once or twice daily for a total of up to 7 days or until adequate wound healing
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A: Humate-P(R): life-threatening hemorrhage, loading dose, 40 to 50 international units/kg followed by 20 to 25 international units/kg every 8 hours to maintain FVIII levels at 80% to 100% of normal for 7 days, then 20 to 25 international units/kg once or twice daily for another 7 days to maintain the FVIII level at 30% to 50% of normal
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): emergency surgery, loading dose 50 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): loading dose calculation involves acquiring individual in vivo recovery (IVR) values and is based on target peak VWF:RCo and FVIII:C levels, when not available a standardized loading dose may be used, VWF:RCo IVR of 2 IU/dL per IU/kg of VWF:RCo product administered
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): initial maintenance dose should be half the loading dose
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): subsequent maintenance dose is based on trough VWF:RCo and FVIII:C levels administered generally every 8 to 12 hours
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Alphanate(R): initial dose, 75 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder: Alphanate(R): subsequent doses, 50 to 75 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV every 8 to 12 hours as needed until healing is complete, dosing may be reduced after the third postoperative dose if necessary
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): 40 to 80 international units VWF:RCo (17 to 33 international units Factor VIII)/kg every IV 8 to 12 hours, repeat as needed; 1 international unit of factor VIII activity/kg will increase the circulating VWF:RCo of approximately 5 international units/dL
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): (type 1 mild disease and VWF:RCo activity greater than 30%) major hemorrhage, loading dose 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV; maintenance dose, 40 to 50 international units VWF:RCo/kg every 8 to 12 hours for 3 days to keep the VWF:RCo trough level greater than 50%; continue 40 to 50 international units VWF:RCo/kg daily for a total of up to 7 days of treatment
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): (type 1 moderate or severe disease and VWF:RCo activity less than 30%), minor hemorrhage, 40 to 50 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV for 1 or 2 doses
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): (type 1 moderate or severe disease and VWF:RCo activity less than 30%) major hemorrhage, loading dose of 50 to 75 international units VWF:RCo/kg; maintenance dose, 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV every 8 to 12 hours for 3 days to keep the VWF:RCo trough level greater than 50%; continue 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg daily for a total of up to 7 days of treatment
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R): (types 2 (all variants) and type 3 disease), minor hemorrhage, 40 to 50 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV for 1 or 2 doses
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Humate-P(R):(types 2 (all variants) and type 3 disease) major hemorrhage, loading dose 60 to 80 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV; maintenance dose, 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg every 8 to 12 hours for 3 days to keep the VWF:RCo trough level greater than 50%; continue 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg daily for a total of up to 7 days of treatment
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Wilate(R): minor hemorrhage, loading dose of 20 to 40 international units of von Willebrand Factor measured with the ristocetin cofactor assay (VWF:RCo)/kg IV at a rate of 2 to 4 mL/min; maintenance dosage, 20 to 30 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV at a rate of 2 to 4 mL/min every 12 to 24 hr for up to 3 days to keep the VWF:RCo and FVIII activity trough levels greater than 30%
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder: Wilate(R): major hemorrhage, loading dose of 40 to 60 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV at a rate of 2 to 4 mL/min; maintenance dosage, 20 to 40 international units VWF:RCo/kg IV at a rate of 2 to 4 mL/min every 12 to 24 hr for up to 5 to 7 days to keep the VWF:RCo and FVIII activity trough levels greater than 50%

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Bleeding - Hemophilia A
  • Bleeding - Surgical procedure - von Willebrand disorder
  • Bleeding - von Willebrand disorder

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• history of anaphylactic or severe systemic response to plasma-derived products, any ingredient in the formulation, or components of the container (Wilate(R))
  • history of anaphylactic or severe systemic response to antihemophilic factor VIII or von Willebrand factor products (Humate-P(R))
  • hypersensitivity to antihemophilic factor VIII, von Willebrand factor, or to any product component (Humate-P(R))

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity has occurred and may lead to severe anaphylaxis; monitoring recommended (Wilate(R))
  • endogenous high levels of factor VIII; may be associated with thrombosis (Alphanate(R), Humate-P(R))
  • females; increased risk of thromboembolic events (Alphanate(R), Humate-P(R))
  • human plasma product; may contain infectious agents including viruses and theoretical risk of Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease agent
  • neutralizing antibodies to von Willebrand factor may occur (Wilate(R))
  • pre-existing thrombosis risk factors; increased risk of thromboembolic events
  • pregnant women and immunocompromised patients; in the event of transmission of infection, parvovirus B19 transmission presents a more serious risk (Alphanate(R), Humate-P(R))
  • sustained excessive levels of von Willebrand factor and factor VIII; increased risk of thrombotic events; monitoring recommended (Wilate(R))
  • report suspected transmission of infection from Humate-P(R) to CSL Behring 1-800-504-5434
  • report suspected transmission of infection from Alphanate(R) to Grifols Biologicals at 1-888-675-2762
  • report suspected adverse reactions from Wilate(R) to Octapharma USA Inc. at 1-866-766-4860 or the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono:
• Antihemophilic Factor: C (FDA)
  • Von Willebrand Factor Complex (Human): Unknown

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• Antihemophilic Factor: WHO: Compatible with breastfeeding.
  • Antihemophilic Factor: Micromedex: Infant risk is minimal.
  • Von Willebrand Factor Complex (Human): Unknown

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Cardiovascular:Edema of face
  • Dermatologic:Pruritus, Rash, Urticaria
  • Gastrointestinal:Nausea
  • Neurologic:Dizziness, Headache, Paresthesia
  • Respiratory:Pharyngitis
  • Other:Factor VIII inhibitor disorder, Pain, Shivering
Serious
  • Hematologic:Fibrinogen in blood above reference range (rare), Hemolytic anemia (rare), Thromboembolic disorder
  • Immunologic:Hypersensitivity reaction
  • Respiratory:Pulmonary thromboembolism
  • Other:Viral disease, Transmission

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Antihemophilic Factor VIII/ von Willebrand Factor Complex (Human) is a lyophilized concentrate of Factor VIII and von Willebrand Factor, which facilitates the activation of Factor X ultimately causing the formation of thrombin and fibrin promoting platelet aggregation and adhesion to damaged vascular endothelium.

1.title: Distribution
1.mono:
• von Willebrand Factor:Ristocetin Cofactor, Vd: 53 to 69.7 mL/kg
  • Factor VIII, Vd: 72.4 mL/kg

4.title: Elimination Half Life
4.mono:
• von Willebrand Factor:Ristocetin Cofactor, 6.91 to 15.8 hr
  • Factor VIII, 12.2 to 19.6 hr

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    for IV administration only
  • Intravenous
    • warm product to room temperature before reconstitution
    • gently swirl vial to dissolve the lyophilized concentrate, do not shake vial
    • administer within 3 hours after reconstitution
    • administer Wilate(R) immediately after reconstitution
    • administer Alphanate(R) slowly, up to a maximum rate of 10 mL/minute.
    • administer Humate-P(R) slowly up to a maximum of 4 mL/minute
    • administer Wilate(R) slowly at a rate of 2 to 4 mL/minute

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• CBC; to monitor for adequate therapeutic response
  • (Alphanate(R)) for treatment of hemophilia A: plasma Factor VIII levels; periodically to evaluate individual patient response to the dosing regimen
  • (Humate-P(R)) for treatment of hemophilia A: plasma Factor VIII activity; frequently in order to individually adjust dose
  • (Humate-P(R)) for prevention of excessive bleeding during and after surgery in patients with von Willebrand disease: Factor VIII levels; using standard coagulation tests, especially in cases of surgery; von Willebrand Factor:Ristocetin Cofactor (VWF:RCo) levels
  • (Humate-P(R)) for prevention of excessive bleeding during and after surgery in patients with von Willebrand disease: trough levels of von Willebrand Factor:Ristocetin Cofactor (VWF:RCo) and plasma Factor VIII activity (FVIII:C) levels; at least once a day to adjust the dosage as needed to avoid excessive accumulation of coagulation factors
  • (Humate-P(R)) for treatment of spontaneous and trauma-induced bleeding in patients with von Willebrand disease: Factor VIII levels; using standard coagulation tests
  • (Humate-P(R)) for treatment of spontaneous and trauma-induced bleeding in patients with von Willebrand disease: trough levels of von Willebrand Factor:Ristocetin Cofactor (VWF:RCo) and plasma Factor VIII activity (FVIII:C) levels; at least once a day to adjust the dosage as needed to avoid excessive accumulation of coagulation factors
  • (Humate-P(R)) for treatment of spontaneous and trauma-induced bleeding in patients with von Willebrand disease: incremental in vivo recovery (IVR) measurements, and baseline plasma von Willebrand Factor:Ristocetin Cofactor (VWF:RCo) and plasma Factor VIII activity (FVIII:C) assessment; prior to surgery
  • (Wilate(R)): appropriate laboratory tests on the patient's plasma; at suitable intervals whenever possible to assure that adequate von Willebrand Factor:Ristocetin Cofactor (VWF:RCo) and plasma Factor VIII activity (FVIII:C) levels have been achieved and are maintained
  • reduction in bleeding episodes is indicative of efficacy
  • plasma levels of von Willebrand Factor:Ristocetin Cofactor (VWF:RCo) and coagulation factor VIII (FVIII) complex activities; to avoid sustained excessive VWF and FVIII activity levels
  • presence of von Willebrand factor and coagulation factor VIII complex inhibitor development
  • signs of intravascular hemolysis and decreasing hematocrit; in patients with type A, B, or AB blood who require large and/or frequent doses
  • (Wilate(R)): pulse rate; before and during injection
  • (Wilate(R)): signs and symptoms of hypersensitivity or allergic reactions that may progress to severe anaphylaxis, including shock

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Alphanate
    Intravenous Powder for Solution: (Antihemophilic Factor VIII Human - Von Willebrand Factor Complex (Human)) 1 IU-1 IU
  • Humate-P
    Intravenous Powder for Solution: (Antihemophilic Factor VIII Human - Von Willebrand Factor Complex (Human)) 1 IU-1 IU
  • Wilate
    Intravenous Powder for Solution: (Antihemophilic Factor VIII Human - Von Willebrand Factor Complex (Human)) 1 IU-1 IU
